nodes.description: Prioritizing economic growth and stability as a core value system.

Actions aimed at improving the quality of life and addressing social needs of Tennessee residents.
Maintaining and improving the ability of businesses to compete effectively in the market.

Developing and expanding systems for collecting, processing, and reusing recyclable materials.

edges.description: Economic Success drives Economic Growth initiatives.
Environmental Stewardship drives initiatives for Environmental Sustainability in Tennessee.
Social Equity guides actions for the Well-being of Tennesseans.
Economic Growth encompasses Business Competitiveness.
Business Competitiveness is a part of Economic Growth.
Environmental Sustainability includes Waste Reduction.
Waste Reduction is a component of Environmental Sustainability.
Environmental Sustainability involves Recycling Infrastructure.
Recycling Infrastructure contributes to Environmental Sustainability.

The Chamber's advocacy for minimizing regulatory impacts and promoting economic sustainability directly supports the purpose of maintaining and improving business competitiveness in the context of EPR legislation.
The Association's role in representing manufacturers' interests likely includes supporting policies that enhance business competitiveness.
The Alliance's focus on sustainable food policies aligns with promoting a Circular Economy.
As an environmental advocacy group, they are likely to support initiatives for Waste Reduction.
Environmental groups often advocate for improved Recycling Infrastructure.
The Association, while representing the packaging industry, might still support the broader concept of a Circular Economy, although their stance on specific EPR regulations might be more nuanced.
As a proponent of EPR, she likely supports its aim of Waste Reduction.
Support for EPR often includes advocating for better Recycling Infrastructure.
His opposition to EPR suggests a prioritization of Business Competitiveness, potentially viewing EPR as negatively impacting it.
Opposition to EPR implies a stance against its core objective of Waste Reduction.
His opposition to EPR likely extends to opposing investments in Recycling Infrastructure.
